Reviews.Title: As an Amateur Photographer, I Love It
Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: I'll note right off the bat -- I've been interested in photography for many years and have been honing my skills, but I am not a professional photographer.  As a result, I can only speak to the qualities of this camera that might appeal to beginner/intermediate photographers.  I owned a previous version of the Canon PowerShot and enjoyed it so much that I decided to purchase this newer model.First, the basic specs.  This camera has a 28mm wide-angle lens, a 16 megapixel sensor, DIGIC 4 image processor, image stabilization, settings for shooting in specific conditions (snow, fireworks, etc.) and numerous special effects (black and white, sepia, miniature, pinhole camera, etc.).  It has sensitivity up to ISO 1600, which is perfect for those who often shoot in low lighting situations.  With this type of camera, however, you're just not going to get the excellent low-light resolution that you will with cameras at a higher price point.  This is only noticeable if you're zoomed in on an image taken at a higher ISO; the resolution in brighter conditions is excellent.One of my favorite features about the camera is its 8x optical zoom; this is a great improvement upon the previous model I've owned.  The image quality and stabilization at a higher zoom is excellent, resulting in perfect images every time.The LCD screen is bright and a great size.  It's easy to review previous pictures and compose a shot using the screen.Although I haven't done much beyond simple experimentation with the movie settings, the camera can shoot 720p HD video (25 frames per second).  The few videos I have recorded have been clear, crisp, and high-quality.  It's not a feature I will use often, but it is an attractive feature for those wanting to capture shorter clips of sporting events, concerts, etc.Thus far, the battery life has been great.  There is an "eco" mode that conserves battery power without reducing image quality or camera performance.Other features that may be of interest include:* Wi-Fi capability to directly upload pictures* "Smart shutter," which automatically takes a picture when a person smiles or gets into frame* Face ID detection* Color accent effect, which retains just one color and makes the rest of the photo black and whiteOverall, I highly recommend this point-and-shoot camera for amateur photographers or for those who simply want a small, portable camera in addition to a DSLR.  The image quality is great, and the price is very competitive.  Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Initial review & Update 1 + correction  - will update with continued usage
Reviews.Author: Michael Rothberg "Michael"
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera today.  I had done extensive research and comparison with other Canon Elph models before choosing this one.A few factors led to my decision:1. I wanted high resolution and high optical zoom capability. Optical zoom is so important because that governs how much raw info you can capture.  Digital zoom is just software and ultimately will result in pixellation.2. The Wifi capability was intriguing, but not a deal breaker.3. The price point was well under $200 ($169) and this was far below the MSRP.  A note on this - I would have opted for a higher priced camera but this is a second camera to be used on an upcoming trip where I did not want to lug my Canon Rebel EOS and all of its lenses.  I would not have chosen an Elph as a primary camera - but for travel, it seemed to be ideal.4. In keeping with the above, I also wanted something I could drop in my fanny pack or shirt pocket (although I am not likely to do that - shirt pocket that is.)5. I chose Canon because of familiarity with the brand and generally good experience with an older Elph I bought for my wife, and of course the EOS and lenses.6. I definitely did not want the touch screen that was offered on some new models simply because - although convenient - they are a royal pain and I often mis-touch the screen requiring go backs, or cancellations and do overs.  For a device this size, buttons seemed to be a better choice. I do use the touch screen on my Motorola Razr Droid Maxx and have learned to live with its idiosynchracies.  I also read some really negative reviews on the touch screens and didn't want to be a guinea pig.So, now that you understand what my decision factors were, here is what I have learned experimenting for the past few hours:PRO- It is intuitively easy to use, and if you know the menu system on one Canon, you will know it here as well.- It is so small and compact, yet the controls are easy to use and they are responsive.- The installation process (software & User's Guide) was relatively easy, and I was able to copy the PDF file to my Google Drive so I will have it while travelling (sans computer).- The images are incredibly crisp and clear with good to excellent color rendition at the M1 (medium) resolution setting.  I usually opt for the highest resolution, but I'll explain why I didn't in the CONS.  I would suggest you always opt for the highest resolution you can since you can always reduce an image without losing clarity, but if you choose too low a resolution, you will experience pixellation on digital enlargement.CONS- The WiFi capability seems like a really nice feature, but you better not be using Windows XP if you want to WiFi the pics to your computer.  You can use a USB connection however. There is a disclaimer in the documentation that the WiFi will only work with Windows 7 or 8.  You can however WiFi to your smartphone (Droid or iPhone with the appropriate app from Google Playstore or Apple) and then share pics from there, or upload them to your computer via the cloud.- The write speed to the SDHC card is uncomfortably slow if you are shooting rapidly, and using very high resolution. The difference between L and M1 is incredible.  With the L resolution, you wait what appears to be an interminable time before you can shoot the next picture.  It's not really that bad, but it is in the "seconds" range.  If it is perceptible enough to be annoying, when testing, it will also be so when out in the field, particularly with action shots.- It would have been nice if Canon included a memory card in the package, but I understand they are trying to keep the price competitive. I'm sure I paid less for a 16GB card than they would have charged.- It also would have been nice if Canon had included a case.  My wife's older Canon Elph came with a quality leather case.  I purchased an after market CaseLogic case for much less than Canon would have charged.- Battery life - I haven't had an opportunity to really test this yet, but I am a little worried since the User Guide states that I will only get about 200 pics per fully charged battery.  Of course there are many variables that contribute to this (i.e., resolution, read/write time to card, ECO mode or not, flash usage or not.)  It's almost impossible to predict exactly how well I will do here, so we'll just have to wait and see.  My concern is that I am going to Scandinavia and Russia, and while I shouldn't have any difficulty charging the battery with the appropriate voltage adaptors, I will probably buy a second battery so I always have a spare charged.(CORRECTION:  You will not need a voltage adaptor.  The charger clearly states 110-240 volts input.  You may need physical plug adapters, although most European hotels have "American" outlets for electric shavers, etc.)- Also note that it took almost two hours to charge the "cold" battery completely. This will probably be shorter when starting with a partially charged battery.I have not had an opportunity yet to test the myriad of other features, such as the various shooting scenarios, lighting conditions, portrait vs scenic, close up vs panorama.  I will test these and report back when I have information with meaningful metrics. If necessary, I will adjust the 5 stars at that time, but for now, I will give Canon the benefit of the doubt based upon my previous experience with the brand.BOTTOM LINE - I would buy it again, and I am completely comfortable with my decision to not opt for a higher end model with a touch screen.Hope this has been helpful.============================================================================****Update 1 - 5/18/2013Well, the learning saga continues.  It's sort of an adventure.  I actually successfully set up a WiFi connection between the camera and my home network with the target device being my Motorola Razr Droid smartphone.The basic steps are to download and install the Canon app for your smartphone and configure it with some very simple settings.  Then configure the camera with the name of the target device (which you assigned in the previous step.)  You then need to scan for WiFi nets from the camera and select the appropriate net, enter the key, and you are pretty much in business.  You are then ready to share the pics from the phone via email, Facebook or whatever mechanism or website you choose.  Play with it; it won't bite.After a little juggling with the settings, I actually sent the pictures to the phone. On a scale of 1 to 10 with 10 being the most difficult, I would give this about a 4. Time expended: about 40 minutes. Not bad.  And the next time will be even easier.My next task will be to try to set this up on an open WiFi network somewhere else.  I imagine I will have to identify the phone again, and let the camera search the available networks.I also noticed that it gave me an option to connect to another network which is probably the Canon cloud.  The name of the network seemed to identify Canon, the camera model and a sequence number. I haven't tried that yet, but I probably will later.In addition, I can use the phone as a wireless access point, so I may be able to send pics to the phone without being on a network ... essentially a point-to-point net of two devices, the phone and the camera.I'm trying to get as much of this exploration done before my trip next month so I don't get frustrated when under pressure.  So far, so good.  Still five stars!============================================================================

Reviews.Title: Amazing new features for an excellent price
Reviews.Author: Ali Pezeshkpour
Reviews.Content: The Canon PowerShot ELPH 130 is the latest Canon PowerShot I've owned, making it probably the third or fourth in about 8 years that I've been using Canon cameras. What draws me to Canon is the amazing picture quality and the ability to truly customize settings, almost as with a digital SLR, without the bulkiness or hefty price tag.This camera is ultra compact. It's perfect for taking with you on hikes, travel, to parties, events, and for any type of photography. The new features that I'll comment on make it definitely worth the money.First, the ability to resize images brings it in line with other makes, like Sony, that have offered that ability for years now. If you are traveling and running low on memory card capacity, then the resize capability is a lifesaver.Second, the WiFi feature is great. It requires you to install a program on your computer or an app on your smartphone, and after initial setup, you can transfer images almost instantly from the camera to another device. This is great, as in the past I have taken both my camera and my smartphone with me on travels so that I could take professional shots (with the camera) and shots for social media (with my phone). Not anymore. Now, it's possible to snap amazing photos with this camera, come back to the hotel, and use the establishment's WiFi to transfer photos to your smartphone, then from there to Facebook, emails, etc.Finally, the 8x optical zoom is amazing. All photos are crisp, sharp, and have excellent lighting. I couldn't ask for more.If you're on the fence as to which camera is right for you, the Canon PowerShot ELPH 130 is the answer.

Reviews.Title: Canon ELPH 130 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: MA
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  I love it.  The pictures are incredible and clear resolution at 16MP.  I also have a Canon T3i and travel alot.  But during travels, the size of the Canon T3i makes it very impractical and heavy.  So the ELPH 130 is my travel camera.  It goes on my hip and takes great pictures.  I especially love the CMOS capability, which makes it a very nice camera for close quarters and limited lighting.  I strongly recommend this camera to anyone looking to buy a camera that takes professional quality pictures at a fraction of the cost of a large professional camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon Elph 130 vs. 330 vs. 520 vs. 115 (as well as 300 and SD780) -- which one to buy?
Reviews.Author: Samuel Chell
Reviews.Content: [(2/10/14) I'm currently seeing an unbeatable price for the Elph 330 of $120 when ordered in silver directly from Amazon (not the same as "Prime").  Recently, Amazon had lowered the price of the Elph 130 below that of any other seller, making it an unbeatable value for Prime subscribers ($93 for the red model).  What you'll get is a pocket rocket with 8X zoom (Canon's most powerful Elph is 12X) plus Wireless Connectivity.  The caveats, or possible "downsides," of the 130: the wide angle lens is an "acceptable" 28mm (not 24mm); the DigiProcessor is the previous edition (4th) rather than the current Digic 5; the maximum aperture is f/3.2, which again is "acceptable"; the camera does not bear the HS suffix (Canon's guarantee of rock-steady low-light shooting).  With these considerations in mind, the extra $30 for an Elph 330 strikes me as irresistible.]Amazon point and shoot shoppers are pretty savvy, as shown by the current listing of most popular models on Amazon.  Of all Canon Elves, the Elph 110 continues to hold a price that's close to retail ($200), thanks to consumer interest and "Consumer Reports" ratings, but it's far from a "value play."  All of the cameras in the title are going for close to, and even under, $100, making each an attractive candidate for anyone looking for a subcompact camera that stands to shoot pictures with better resolution and sharper detail than a smartphone camera.The choice could easily come down to appearance --for example, a preference for the sharp edges and classic boxy look of the compact but highly competent 500 series over the somewhat "softer"-looking 130.  But from the low-priced Elph 115 to the Elph 520, the dimensions, features, and actual results will be remarkably similar, with any particular Elph capable of producing the best pictures in the hands of a skilled and experienced photographer.The features that should be of least interest to the shopper are: 1. megapixels (10 is often as good if not better than 20); 2. movie pixels (720 will be as "high def" to viewers'  eyes as 1080p); 3. size of screen (2.5" is as useful as 3" or larger, and any size can be worthless under a bright overhead sun); 4. the power of the zoom lens (telephoto lenses should not be a priority for the buyer of a subcompact camera--a lens of greater than 5:1 power may be an indication that the buyer should be looking at a larger camera, such as the Canon Powershot 260-280 line).The features that matter most to experienced photographers are: 1. focal length, especially where the wide angle lens is concerned (28mm is good, but 24mm is better, ensuring better focusing because of greater depth of field as well as the possibility of capturing a large cathedral without backing away by an extra block or two); 2. aperture--for low and and indoor available light shooting, a lens that opens up to f2.8 is better than one opening to f3.2. just as a lens that opens to f2.0 (as on my Canon Elph SD4000) will produce measurably better low-light results than an f2.8 lens; 3. "Burst Mode," which is especially useful (if not essential) for capturing images of pets and active children at just the "right instant"; 4. face detection and automatic shutter (when I tell my grandkids to hold still for a picture, I'm usually ignored; when, on the other hand, I tell them that the camera will "magically" take their picture if they look at it and smile, I or, rather, the camera suddenly has an attentive audience.  5.  Wi-fi, for those photographers who have been spoiled by their smartphones and wish to maintain "social connectivity" while having access to a "Cloud" where their pictures will be instantly stored and backed up.For most viewers, the Elph 130 comes closest to offering the most features for the least money--a camera that, in 2009, would have cost 2-3 times its present price.  HOWEVER, it doesn't have burst mode and, perhaps more importantly, the wide-angle lens is 28mm rather than 24mm. The Elph 330, therefore, deserves careful consideration for anyone who plans, for example, to shoot pets and appreciates the advantages of a wide-angle over a big zoom lens.  The Elph 520 looks highly attractive--on paper. But despite its ultra compactness and power, the reviews by users have not inspired confidence in the camera.  It's going for close to a hundred, so it may be worth a gamble if you can buy it from Amazon Prime and try it for 30 days (the new Digi 5 processor has not been getting high marks and may require some improvements.  In fact, Canon's newest Elph, the 340 (yet to be released), returns to the proven Digi-4 processor. Personally, I found that Canon's discontinued Elph 300 came closest to satisfying my wish list.  By looking at "Like New" models offered by sellers through Prime (for easy returns), I found my Elph at my price point.  Yet I continue to hang on to my "old" SD780 for those bright, sunny days since it was Canon's very last Elph with a viewfinder.Finally, you'll need an SD card.  If you plan to take movies, better make it 16GB.  And while you're at it, don't forget to pick up an extra Canon battery (the Canon SX160 may have been the last Canon to take regular alkaline batteries, and some Panasonics still make it easy by requiring a simple plug-in of the camera into any available AC outlet).  If you plan to get a case, be sure to check out the custom-fitted leather ones made by Canon, as some are currently being offered at a steep discount.

Reviews.Title: nice little camera for casual user
Reviews.Author: julie akyol "amazon queen"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera early in March and the price is already reduced by $20+ !  Anyway, I am mostly happy with my purchase. What I like: size and light weight, several settings for special effects and different shooting situations, easy to figure out, wifi.  What I don't like: I use an android tablet and do not have the ability to use Canon Image Maker to download and play with my photos...it requires a cd rom to install the program components, :-(.  I was able to download an app to allow the wifi to download to my tablet gallery, but can't make use of what the canon software would allow me to do. This is a big disappointment.  So far, I havent had any problems with battery life....I just came back from vacation and took several hundred pictures with no problems.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Horrible WiFi
Reviews.Author: BlueCrabVintage
Reviews.Content: If wireless connectivity to your home computer network is important to you then do not buy this camera. I have tried everything from uninstalling and reinstalling the software to 3 times reading the totally useless instructions manual. I would even consider calling in an African witchdoctor if I knew of one in my area and his rates were reasonable. What makes it even more frustrating is that my computer says the camera is connected, even displays the freaking brand and model number, but the camera ain't buying it and continually says no connection found. On the other hand it connects to my smartphone just fine but that is not what I need. Now let me tell you what this camera does well and that is take pictures. Great  outdoor shots and unbelievably great indoor shots of small items such as Jewelry which is very difficult to photograph. And although I have read reviews stating otherwise, I find the battery life to be phenomenal. The anti-shake feature works great as I have yet to have a need to use a tripod. To use this feature is optional which I don't get, I mean why wouldn't you want it on all the time? So to sum it up, the connectivity problems aside I'm happy with this purchase and hope there was some info here that will help you decide if this camera is right for you.

Reviews.Title: Very Poor Customer Service
Reviews.Author: kirk williams
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for Christmas of 2013 and it won't take pictures in the vertical position.I spoke with customer service, was told this model a new model , and there was no question that it was in warrantee.I sent it back to Canon, was told it was out of warrantee, and they want $119.00 to fix it!Never again will I buy a cano product and everyone else should take heed!UPDATETHANKS TO AMAZON'S OFFER TO  ACCEPT THE RETURN  OF THE CAMERA, CANON DECIDED TO CHANGETHEIR MINDS AND SEND ME A NEW CAMERA.AMAZON IS A CLASS OPERATION!!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, memory card errors cause picture loss
Reviews.Author: Adam Bliss
Reviews.Content: We purchased ours over a year ago. The camera reported memory card issues a few times and each time we lost some pictures. I've reformatted the card a few times but the issues return intermittently. I'm currently running a different memory card and the camera reported another error and this time the entire card seems to be unreadable. These are brand name cards, class 10 speed. I finally realized that it's the camera. Maybe I have a lemon..I don't know. I have other Canon camera's operate well, but I can't recommend this model.

Reviews.Title: Poor focus in low light
Reviews.Author: Eve B.
Reviews.Content: I've owned Canon, Fuji, Nikon, Olympus, and Panasonic digicams in the $100-$200 range.  I know how to focus and shoot a digicam under low light conditions.  Having read glowing reviews both by professionals and users, I thought the Powershot ELPH would suit my needs, once the price dropped to nearly half of msrp.This is the only Canon I've had that focused so poorly in zoom mode, and under moderately low light conditions.  I don't know if I just got a lemon.  After failing that criterion, I did not even want to explore the rest.  My mistake was the lure of the pricepoint. I could have gotten a more spendy Canon HS (high sensitivity) model which takes better low light pictures.I returned this for a FinePix F660EXR.When they say the ELPH models are small, they mean it! I am female with child sized hands and fingers. The selector circle is so small,  I found it easier to use a fingernail than a fingertip to activate the piece of the circle I needed to hit. I have never had to do that on any other camera. If you just put it on auto, drilling through menus should not be problematic for you.On a right-handed gripping position, my fingers look for a rest on the camera face. The only thing to hang onto, on the front is the slightly raised metal logo with sharply defined edges. Would have preferred a rubber grip there, or a smoothly beveled logo. If I'd have kept the camera, I would have stuck a dorky silicone nosepad over it. It may be nitpicky but it detracts from the comfort of handling the camera.Pros- Metal construction with metal (not plastic) tripod mount- Ultra Compact- Large 3" screen- Intuitive menu controlsCons- Impossibly small selector dial- Poor focus in low light zoom- Rough Canon logo

Reviews.Title: This is a nice, light weight camera.
Reviews.Author: ElaineJ
Reviews.Content: I bought this because it was a Canon and I wanted something that I could just slip into any bag. It takes great photos for a point and shoot. It's battery life is very good.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a great price!
Reviews.Author: aubrey
Reviews.Content: Perhaps this is just coming from a girl whose previous camera was a piece of junk, but this camera is fantastic!  The pictures are crisp and clear, the flash reloads quickly, and the battery seems to have a very long life.  The digital zoom even produces decent quality pics, which is incredibly rare with this kind of camera.I am still exploring the extra features, but those that I have seen so far are too much fun!If I had to pick one piece for improvement, I would want the shutter speed to be a smidge faster, but it really isn't that slow at all.I would absolutely recommend this camera to someone looking for a quality, inexpensive, point-and-shoot with tons of settings that takes excellent pictures.

Reviews.Title: Canon Rights a Wrong
Reviews.Author: jbcmass "jbcmass"
Reviews.Content: We have had a number of Canon Elphs over the years and we have been very pleased with their performance.  We bought our last one (SD1100IS) over 4 years ago.  We have had this unit (Canon Elph 130 IS) for just over a month and have been very disappointed with it.  The pictures are not sharp (at any zoom) and the automatic lighting adjustments tend to overexpose the pictures.  We are looking to see if we can return it - the 30 days is up from Amazon but we may be able to return it as defective through our credit card.  I definitely would not recommend this camera to anyone.10/14/2013 Update - I decided to return the camera to Canon under warranty. Within 5 days of sending it back, I received a refurbished camera from Canon.  This one works much better.  The lighting is correct and the focus is much better - not perfect, but pretty good (perhaps I am spoiled by my Canon DSLR and L series lenses).  While the one I bought was a dud, Canon was able to quickly right a wrong.  I now rate the camera a 4 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: It Works
Reviews.Author: Debby
Reviews.Content: I don't have a cell phone camera, so this nifty little gadget works for me. Excellent focus, beautiful color, and some pretty amazing automatic stuff. I'm glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Super small modestly priced bargain
Reviews.Author: C. J. Clavadetscher "quickshot carl"
Reviews.Content: I own a lot of cameras. The one in my pocket is the ELPH 130 IS. It is at the low end of my set price wise. It is near the top in quality overall and features. Want one camera on a budget that will take quality pictures, zoom in and grab those images, at a really modest price? This is it.

Reviews.Title: Love the Canon Elph cameras
Reviews.Author: BB
Reviews.Content: This is my third Canon Elph camera in the past 10 or so years.  I can't say enough good things about these cameras.  The only reason I got this one is because mine got dropped on a fishing pier while on vacation. Surprising it did NOT break the camera lens . It still take pictures-but I couldn't review them on the old camera . I had to put the SD card in a computer to view them.  This new camera is a couple years newer model from my old one.  I LOVE IT!  Awesome pictures. Easy to use. Easy to download and great for fitting in my purse, pockets, camera bag!  Also great price!

Reviews.Title: Great Customer Service-Replacement
Reviews.Author: Casey Ruggles
Reviews.Content: I received the camera and it worked fine for about a day. The next day, a "lens error" would show up and it would not let me power the camera on. I called amazon and I spoke to a woman who was very nice and helpful and said they could send me a replacement that would arrive two days from now. Since this was a time sensitive issue I was very impressed it arrived so quickly. The new version works great and could not be happier. I was frustrated at first but after dealing with great customer service, I wasn't so bothered by it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Bob C
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures. Stability system seems to work well with zoom to eliminate most blur caused by shaking.

Reviews.Title: GREAT!
Reviews.Author: The1one
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Canon Powershot upgrade.  It just keeps getting better.  I LOVE this camera from the bigger LCD screen to the ability to send pics to Facebook and other social networks via Wi-Fi w/o the use of a usb cord.  It's light and easy to operate and the zoom is great! Keep up the good work Canon!

Reviews.Title: Love my little canon powershot
Reviews.Author: Rachel Diaz
Reviews.Content: The small size is great and the pictures look like a professional photographer took them! I would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Get Ready for the WOW Factor!!
Reviews.Author: Amanda Scholz
Reviews.Content: So,I would say I LOVE this camera with the small exception that it doesn't do fast/action shots very well.  And by not very well, I mean that it does all right its just not quite as quick as I'd like.  I also readily admit that it could be user ignorance on what my settings should be.I should mention that I had an older model of this until I dropped it in some water, twice.  I LOVED that camera which made me look to the same brand and model for my replacement.  A lot of the reviews I read said that this camera didn't do night shots very well...I call BS.  I haven't had a camera that does night shots so well, EVER.  No tri-pod needed and I'm getting minimal to no shake and crisp brilliant photos at night.  I use the camera for a lot of close up macro-shots for my jewelry business and it does brilliantly at that.  I love the different functions and the ease of use.I haven't tapped into the wireless settings.  Could be easy, but they are hard enough to set up that I just haven't bothered yet.  That wasn't really a factor when I made my decision.I have had this camera for about a month now and the more I use it, the more I love it.  I'm going to do some research to see if I can't figure out how to get some nice action shots out of it.  It used to be a kids and pets setting on my old one that did the trick but this one doesn't have that.I would say that if you are looking for a point and shoot that takes exceptional photos that is easy to use and fits in your pocket...this is your ticket.Happy shopping!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 130 IS 16.0 MP Digital Camera with 8x Optical Zoom...
Reviews.Author: Sandy S "Sandy S"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace the exact same one that I ran over with our 4X4 a few days ago. My old one was great and I took about 100 pictures with this new one and it takes awesome pictures. I'm very happy with it and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it. It is light weight and small enough to easily fit into a small purse or a pocket.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Jenica
Reviews.Content: This camera works great! Its very easy to use and I love how fast the camera takes pictures. Although its not the fastest it takes pictures in a timely manner.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera With A Terrible Battery
Reviews.Author: George
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice little camera ruined by a very bad power/charging feature set. This camera has a really nice large screen... that's powered by a pathetic 680mAh battery. I fully charged it after unboxing, and about 2 hours after fiddling around with the settings and taking only 2 pictures with it, the low battery icon started flashing, already down to 1/3 power.Here's the deal breaker: it won't charge over USB. Seriously? Call me demanding but it's simply unacceptable for a new product like this in 2013 to not charge over USB. After 5 hours plugged into a USB wall charger it hadn't charged at all.To have a really low power battery that discharges so fast just exacerbates this issue. Canon seriously expects me to lug around the charger that's literally the same size as the camera? It's about 1/3 thicker than the camera itself and almost 90% as long. There's not much point in having a nice compact camera if we have to lug around this massive battery charger along with it.I could live with the short battery life if it would charge over USB, but its failure to do this makes this item useless to me.Canon: put a higher capacity battery in your next camera and put a micro USB connector on it that I can charge with my cell phone chargers and I will buy it. But this one is going back.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera/Price
Reviews.Author: Mitch "Jerry"
Reviews.Content: The Elph 130 IS  takes excellent photo's and fits in your pocket with ease.  I have several cameras, Nikon D2X ($5000 Body), D300 ($2000), Sony RX100 ($700), Sony Cyber-shot DSC-TX200V ($600) and other small compacts.  This Elph takes just as good of a picture as the others I own.  I mainly bought it because of the size and the WiFi feature.  This was a great purchase at an excellent price, very happy.  Make sure you use at least a class 10 memory card.

Reviews.Title: Nice for the price!
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: Very small and thin, good zoom, re-chargeable battery. Great point and shoot camera. Don't expect miracles with any camera that costs about $100. Came with a soft case

Reviews.Title: Outstanding value for a quality product
Reviews.Author: Willie of Virginia "Golf is my Passion"
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, even for my wife whose hands shake. The picture comes out crisp and clear just point and click.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: plinkerman
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  Takes pictures in low light like a champ and the automatic mode takes all the work and mistakes out of getting a great picture.  Very small yet has a big screen to view your scenes.  Batteries charge up fairly quickly and the software is easy to do.  Can get 100+ pictures before another battery is needed with the 32 gb card I purchased seperately.  Really nice little camera!!

Reviews.Title: Great little pocket camera for vacations
Reviews.Author: AZHome "AZHome"
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures, it's compact and good for taking on vacations.  But as with many point and shoot digital cameras, it decides when to trip the shutter.  Not so great for action shots and moving subjects.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Software
Reviews.Author: sifxtreme
Reviews.Content: The software to install on the computer is a pain in the butt! It is also extremely difficult to connect to Wifi which is the whole selling point of this camera. Very frustrated with the software side of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice!
Reviews.Author: J. Brad Yeates "ForeJacks"
Reviews.Content: Great little camera. Works very well. Super clear shots. Easy to use and easy to use all the functions. Love the battery charging.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: Wizzard "gwitte2"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great.  It takes excellent pictures.  The 8X optical zoom is fantastic.  The size is perfect for my needs.  The one button video record capability is a nice feature.  I am very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Canon standard of awesomeness
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: Got this to replace an old powershot. Love the Canon powershot series. Small, compact, and fast. Packed with software features that I don't even use, but friends who have the same camera love the extra features.

Reviews.Title: a tad slow
Reviews.Author: Pontifex
Reviews.Content: good camera with nice features and capacity. it is a tad slow when taking one picture to the next, even with a high speed memory card.

Reviews.Title: Does not have same shooting modes as previous models
Reviews.Author: katealex4
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about a year and a half ago and was very happy with it.  Unfortunately, I got sand in the lens over the summer and could not get it to work again.  I replaced it with the current model and was very unhappy when I went to use it and realized it didn't have all the same shooting modes as my other one.  Of course it was missing the ones I use the most  - kids/pets (for objects that are moving) and high speed burst (quick sequences of pictures).  I had to return the camera.  This newer model may have more zoom and wifi, but I cannot use it and liked the old model better.

Reviews.Title: Set Up Is Painful
Reviews.Author: Ranada
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have been setting up this camera for hours and we're still not done.  You have to install software, register the camera, register for an account on their website, download updated software (because the original software they provided is outdated).  It is truly as un-user-friendly as it could possibly be.  The camera better be awesome to make up for this hassle.  So far I'm beyond disappointed in the product.  Also, the whole point of getting the camera was for the wi-fi function and despite the hours we have spent installing and re-installating software and registering and re-registering for accounts, the wi-fi still is not working.  Sheesh!

Reviews.Title: inferior
Reviews.Author: G. Burnick
Reviews.Content: I'm a Canon Elph fan -- have had several and still do. Wanted to upgrade to a 16mp. I got this and compared same images taken with my 10mp. My 10mp took much better photos. In fact, these were particularly dark. Returned this immediately.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed in camera
Reviews.Author: David Zhang
Reviews.Content: We bought the camera for our vacation to Florida. I've never had a problem with Canon cameras before this one. Unfortunately, we were very disappointed with this particular model. Although all the photos had a yellowy tinge, we figured it was a cheaper camera and had no complaints because it worked fine. Three days into using the camera, it has completely stopped working. We still can't figure out what is wrong with it as it will not turn on. We will be contacting Amazon to see what they can do for us.

Reviews.Title: The quality isn't there...
Reviews.Author: jediblulady
Reviews.Content: I bought the OLD version of this camera and LOVED it. When that camera was broken I just figured I'd buy the most recent version... most of my images are really grainy even on the highest resolution. This works for quick snaps, but just doesn't have the quality I'm used to...

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Seattle Thinker "Fred"
Reviews.Content: Obviously, this is not a DSLR, but for the price, it is great. All the pics I took with it while traveling were super sharp and the colors are great - even the ones taken from a moving car. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Technology goes up and price comes down
Reviews.Author: J. Hess
Reviews.Content: I have used an earlierr model elph which I thought was great. This new model with wi-fi and increased resolution exceeded my expectations and at a great price.

Reviews.Title: Great features and price
Reviews.Author: Jameson
Reviews.Content: Great small size with incredible picture quality and good zoom capabilities for such a small camera. The vidoe button comes in very handy when someting  is happening that you want to catch on video right away.

Reviews.Title: good camera love the wifi
Reviews.Author: Son of Detroit "Robb L."
Reviews.Content: I don't like taking pictures with my phone,it's got a good camera(Samsung s3).  this camera has a wi-fi option that's pretty cool, yes im a little of a geek so it took a little bit to get the camera to connect to my phone, my wifes phone, the computer, etc.  o.k. the camera, I geeked out! it takes great shots, small camera size-wise, zoom works great(8x's optical is awesome), works o.k. in low-light(unless you drop$$$ you not gonna find a point and shoot camera that takes GREAT pictures in low-light). large, easy-to-use lcd screen on back.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot ELPH 130
Reviews.Author: Newkster
Reviews.Content: This camera has met all my needs. It works as advertised. Pictures are excellent and stabilization  is very good. The only issue is that the camera battery cannot me charged through the USB cable.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Russell J Hall "Lighthall"
Reviews.Content: This is my third Canon digital elph. I've carried them with me while backpacking, and have gotten many excellent images with them. I have owned this latest one for several months and so far have captured nearly 1,200 images with it. I selected this model primarily for its optics, the 8x optical zoom and wide angle capability being particularly attractive. This combination is rare in small cameras and, as things appear, may be too good to be true. Particularly in the wide angle mode, which I've used normally for landscape shots, and in certain lighting conditions, a disturbing fogginess appears near the center of images. One might think there was a smudge on the lens, but the problem does not appear in images made in close-up or telephoto modes. My guess is that extraneous light is getting in when shooting wide-angle photos. Overall the camera has performed competently, but some otherwise excellent images are flawed and unusable.

Reviews.Title: Takes nice photos
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: Great point and shoot camera with quality photos. The only problem is that you have to remove the battery to charge it.

Reviews.Title: Good Looking Specs; Focuses Poorly
Reviews.Author: Jayhawk Aviator
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera and tried it.  I don't know if it was just our particular one or the model in general, but this one we had just would NOT focus with any quality at all when zoomed at all (optical, not digital).  We had digital zoom off, which means we were using only optical zoom.  At my daughter's school play, about 40% of the photos were unfocused or slightly out of focus when taken on medium zoom (probably about 4-5x of the 8x range).Anyway, we returned this and went back to our five plus year old Canon Powershot.  Specs aren't anywhere near as good as this one purports to be, but it focuses quickly and takes good photos.  I wanted to try to get a better optical zoom but I don't think this one can do it.  DSLRs are out because of the bulk.  I would not recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Cool Delivery
Reviews.Author: Shirley Capron
Reviews.Content: I was impressed how fast the Camera came. in just 3 days I got it.Also it works beautifully. I love the camera and would recommend it to my friends. I love the Zoom on it. Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot ELPH 130 IS
Reviews.Author: millerbe
Reviews.Content: Nice little camera so far.  I downloaded everything easily.  My only problem has bee working with the picture file.  All my pictures from the old file transferred but I still can't figure out how to attach.  I actually began taking pictures the very first night even though I am not very digital savvy.

Reviews.Title: Nice simple little camera.
Reviews.Author: F. Stuart Phillips
Reviews.Content: Camera is just what I wanted. Sweet little camera to keep in a pack or pocket. It was easy to set up and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Battery and Camera Died Quickly
Reviews.Author: H. Knapp
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera but that rechargable battery cost us a good shot.  My "shutter-bug spouse" says it gave no warning of it's low charge condition.  Just failed to take the picture.  Then and only then it told her the battery was depleted.  :-(Added 5/25/14:  Lens locked up. Tried everything but nothing worked.  This camera died as suddenly as its battery.  No warning, damage, water - just locked and died.  Good camera for two years.

Reviews.Title: Great compact camera
Reviews.Author: Paul C. Aaron
Reviews.Content: This camera really performs like the much more expensive ones. I wanted a compact camera to take on a 3 country tour of Europe and not have to carry around a large weight around my neck. This little camera fits in my shirt or pants pocket so it was always with me. I took over 250 pictures in 8 days and did not have one single bad picture. It did great night shots, indoor shots (with or without flash), and the movie feature was really nice to gather the night lights of Budapest and the Danube. VERY easy to use. The only change I made from time to time was the flash for museums and churches that did not allow flash. Those shots came out great.

Reviews.Title: Best little digital so fn
Reviews.Author: Susie
Reviews.Content: Point and shoot with ease and nice quality that is good enough to make photo books and the like. I love my cell phone camera, but the quality  is not as good as this nice little Canon.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: JEG "CTreader"
Reviews.Content: Have had this for three years now.  Takes great pictures.  Easy to use.  Very compact.  Zoom feature excellent. Only problem is I sometimes turn on the video when I only want pictures.  Small size makes it easy to accidentally hit button.  Probably not for the really serious photographer, but it makes me look like a much better one than I used to be.

Reviews.Title: The ELPH is the greatest!
Reviews.Author: Lynda Gray
Reviews.Content: The Canon PowerShot ELPH 130 is a great little camera.  It is convenient enough to carry in my purse so it's handy whenever I need it.  I'm really impressed with the clarity of the pictures.....for such a small camera, it is full of the latest technology.  I haven't had a chance yet to try out all of the manual settings; thus the 4 stars.  I'm sure I will be getting my money's worth and then some from it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: shelley kimbel
Reviews.Content: I really love this camera although setting it up was not as easy as I thought the instructions helped but the process needs to be a little more simpler other than that love the camera

Reviews.Title: Easy to use camera
Reviews.Author: Lauren Swan
Reviews.Content: I have purchased several of these cameras over the years. If you treat it right its a great little camera. Lightweight, takes great photos. The only downfall is when the camera does not survive your drunken shenanigans. Camera is not friends with liquid, especially beer.

Reviews.Title: The metalic RED body camera will leave a red glare on certain pictures
Reviews.Author: tonibag "tonibag"
Reviews.Content: First off....LOVE the mechanics of the camera, easy to use, "most" pictures come out great.  I purchased the metalic red bodied camera because it was cheaper and it was in stock.....I didn't particularly care how it looked.  I use this camera primarily for items I post to Ebay.  Most of my pictures come out great.......BUT, if you are close-up photographing an item that might have a reflective surface (a knife blade, silverware, crystal jewelry) you WILL have redness on the reflective surfaces in your finished photo.  The red metal camera body reflects.  Again....this was only an issue for close-up pictures of reflective items that I sell on Ebay......unfortunately for me, that is a lot of pictures.  Also unfortunately I figured this out too late to exchange it.Buy this camera, but to play it safe, just don't get the red bodied version.

Reviews.Title: Compact and outstanding
Reviews.Author: Claudio Andre Heckler
Reviews.Content: This little gem is very compact but packs great features. Its full-auto mode gets most shot right without demanding much from the user, while the scene and semi-manual modes allow for creativity and more targeted shooting.Battery life is better than I'd expect for such a small cell, have taken a couple hundred photos on the very first charge (about 1 in 10 with flash) before it needed recharging.The "panorama" mode was confusing at first, I expected it to stitch the photos in the camera, but it is mainly an alignment aid; once I got that, it became clear how to use it.Cannot comment on wifi as I have not used, nor I intend to. To post directly to social media is something I do from my phone, not the camera.  Instead of wifi, I'd have liked more if there was a GPS option to geo-tag photos, that'd use constantly ...Final thoughs: this is an excellent compact camera, and so small I am prone to have it always on me; a great companion to the DSLR, but also would not look bad as your main camera if you're not too demanding.

Reviews.Title: I purchased this as a gift for my mom
Reviews.Author: Shelby
Reviews.Content: I wanted to get her a camera that was easy to learn and to use regularly, and I would say overall this camera does that for her. The one negative thing I would say is that sometimes the camera is trying to focus on faces so long that it misses the shot entirely, which is a little disappointing. Overall I am satisfied with this purchase, though.

Reviews.Title: Very poor battery life
Reviews.Author: bilwhit
Reviews.Content: Nice little camera. I was looking for the slimmest camera available, which would have been a certain Samsung.  But the much better zoom on this one made me buy it instead.  However, the battery is a problem.  I charged it one day, carried it around a few days, took maybe 7 or 8 trial photos, then later the battery was drained.  I've recharged it and recorded the date (2-3-14) and I'll see how it goes.

Reviews.Title: Very happy
Reviews.Author: Chelsea Anne "Chelsea"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. I love the wireless function for my ipad and phone (when it works...) and it does take good photos. I admit, the series I owned before this (also Canon Powershot) took better photos, but these are still great and I love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice design, lots of fun settings, decent camera
Reviews.Author: Artist Maur611
Reviews.Content: Packaged well, in standard Canon box with all the gadgets. Overall I like the camera however I'm slightly disappointed with the color resolution and more let down by the zoom quality. Vivid mode is waaaayy too saturated in my opinion and for a standard shot with no effects or flash I feel most colors are too unsaturated, then again I haven't used it excessively so maybe I need more time to configure my personal settings (I prefer manual over auto anyway). When going into full optical zoom, obviously we're not using an SLR zoom lens, but the pictures are certainly blurred and pixelated. In general I found zooming in caused a lot of blurry problems, it seemed a little harder than my last powershot to focus on images (which I don't understand because that one was from '09). On occasion I get poor quick shots as well- given they are quick shots, but I believe a point and shoot is supposed to be designed for capturing a moment quickly and efficiently. They aren't terrible, just slightly blurry or over exposed.These comments are very nit picky rather than obvious issues I'm finding with the device. I have not owned a point and shoot in a while and only have had an SLR so I just need to get used to the change in quality, but it has impressed me and I'm glad I chose this camera over other canon's. It has just the right amount of necessary features and MP to get you really great quality and also give you options.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera
Reviews.Author: Vu Hoang
Reviews.Content: This camera takes better pictures that the Canon A"x" (been a while so i forgot the exact model) as well as the Canon IOS cameras that we've had in the past.It was fast at first few pictures but then slow down.  We use the Sandisk 64GB Ultra SDXC (30MB/s) and thought that was the bottle neck.  After newly reformatting the card, the speed didn't quite improve.  Not sure what the problem is.It's small enough to fit in any pocket (just remember not to sit on it while it's on the back pocket.)The battery life is pretty decent.Overall, it's a good camera.  I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: This is the way to go if you don't call yourself a pro.
Reviews.Author: Carolyn Seidl
Reviews.Content: Takes great pics and has a nice zoom.  I'm not trying to take professional pics but I do like quality and this camera takes wonderful pics.  The speed at which pics are taken is pretty good.  It take the camera a few seconds to be ready to take the next pic but it works for me.

Reviews.Title: Have always liked the digital ELPHs.
Reviews.Author: Euphorbia
Reviews.Content: Wireless doesn't work with a Mac... too bad.  Otherwise nice features.  Sometimes doesn't focus on particular colors up close (ie for macro shots.)  Sort of hard to navigate the themes compared to older versions.  Nice for wide landscape shots though.  Also no touchscreen on this one, which is a good thing.

Reviews.Title: Poorer image quality than my previous ELPH
Reviews.Author: Sheri
Reviews.Content: This camera was a replacement for an older model ELPH that I used in my work, but the image quality is so much poorer than its predecessor that I'm going to have to buy another camera to replace the replacement. The older ELPH took excellent macro photos with crisp details, but this one's photos aren't sharp at any distance. I've seen smartphone photos that were much higher quality, so I can't even recommend this camera for casual use.

Reviews.Title: Like the wi-fi, great camera, prefer this over a touch screen version
Reviews.Author: Heather M
Reviews.Content: Great camera - I've owned a few PowerShots and this one is great!  I use the wi-fi feature.  I did purchase a touch screen version previously and returned it as the functions were hard to use on the touch screen.  I definitely prefer buttons - I don't have fat fingers, but the touch screen made me feel like I did.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy
Reviews.Author: Pleasant
Reviews.Content: This camera has a yellow tint on all the photos.  I wanted to return but was beyond the 30 days.  The price was reduced and I can see why. Poor quality.

Reviews.Title: Ok camera works good
Reviews.Author: Victor A. Steckhan "Viktory2k1"
Reviews.Content: Camera actually works great. Long battery life and lots of options.My only complaint is windows xp will not allow wi-fi function to work.Otherwise I would have given it 5 stars

Reviews.Title: Small compact
Reviews.Author: Shenejm
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter to take to Paris... upon her return I was amazed by the photos she took... Clear and colorful.. She enjoyed using the camera and said it was a joy to carry because of its size... I liked it due to the Wi-Fi connectivity she was able to take pictures and transfer them to her phone and send us photos daily of her adventures....

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: jeeplover
Reviews.Content: this camera is the best I've used for a point and shoot camera. It has some awesome features, and it takes incredible close-up pictures!no complaints

Reviews.Title: Packs a lot of power
Reviews.Author: Jocelynleah
Reviews.Content: For such a tiny little camera and a reasonable price, this thing is quite awesome! I have yet to sit down and learn how to actually use all the settings on it, but I recently recorded a video of my daughter's dance recital from the furthest back and highest up row in a performing arts center, and the camera was able to zoom right in to focus on my daughter with a picture that was MUCH BETTER than I expected... I was really, really far away.... My dad kept saying that he couldn't get over how great of a video it was for such a tiny little camera and from such a distance... I am very happy with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: I would give this a 3 1/2 start
Reviews.Author: micheal scott loew
Reviews.Content: Easy to use.  Camera not great in low light situations.  Lots of indoor pictures are amber color or washed out.Outdoor  photos turned great for a compact.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Pam Fosterling
Reviews.Content: Great pictures even in auto.The lithium battery has a long charge life. The only problem is the buttons are very small and a problem for big hands.

Reviews.Title: CANON PowerShot
Reviews.Author: Linda Rugenstein
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to take pictures with the zoom lens that were also in focus.  This camera does that, and I'm very pleased with the picture quality.  The camera is also easy to use.  I recommend it for everyone.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Peggy Lyman
Reviews.Content: We love it. Works well for us in out business. Very clear.  We would buy another one when the others we have need replacing

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: wanda
Reviews.Content: Its compact and takes great pictures.  At first u felt overwhelmed because my husband always takes pictures on vacation well I had to read the book so I can take good pictures. Its very easy to operate.

Reviews.Title: Great Zooming
Reviews.Author: Donna Harper
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. I purchased it for the zooming capabilities. The camera that I had was awful with zooming in. The picture would be grainy and you wouldn't be able to make out what I was taking a picture of. I haven't found anything I dislike except that it doesn't come with a case. But it's worth the money and I do recommend it to anyone looking for great zooming capabilities.So I give it high marks.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: jennki18
Reviews.Content: Pros - Easy to use, inexpensive, nice pictures and long battery life.Cons - I don't use it enough with the ease of the camera on my Note 3.

Reviews.Title: Complicated
Reviews.Author: Richard Casey
Reviews.Content: This camera has bells and whistles that I have never heard of and trying to find out how to work this thing is way above my head. I takes pics - so did my old camera, but that is about all.  I did like the zoom on it.  Nothing is easy anymore.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Michael Eastman
Reviews.Content: Having limited motion in my arms and shoulders which has limited using my wife's Canon and its larger lenses is what had me searching for smaller compact camera. I've been using this camera for about a month and a half now. So easy to use, to upload photos with and having HD video is a plus. Never thought I'd use it much but I find myself taking videos quite a lot,Only issue is setting up the wi-fi upload.  It take sometime and some patience but it is really worth it. My wife has been skipping out on using her more professional camera just because of the using a cord to load and loading time with photos. With this you just set it down and browse the web, then in a few minutes its done.Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Valerie Pakaluk
Reviews.Content: I am not and I repeat NOT a photographer but am planning a vacation this summer overseas where it won't be feasible to take my iPhone.  After much investigating, reading and actually going to stores to hold this in my hands I settled for the Canon PowerShot which is exactly like they say...."point and shoot"  It's very easy to set up and takes great pictures. Hopefully by the time I leave I'll be a master at digital picture taking.  I did purchase a spare battery just in case.

Reviews.Title: Excellent shipping
Reviews.Author: Anumati
Reviews.Content: I am not the best photographer, but this works for me. Easy, handy and clear pictures. A solution for saving my best memories

Reviews.Title: canon powershot
Reviews.Author: sandy
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures.  Bring it to your outdoor activities  and in every lighting performs well.  would recommend this for a beginner picture taker.

Reviews.Title: Great item
Reviews.Author: Sexy Nadia "Nades"
Reviews.Content: This item rocks,. I love the way it takes pictures. It really easy to use. I recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Really Like My Cannon!
Reviews.Author: Judy B.
Reviews.Content: My son recommed it and ordered it for me. I really like it as it takes excellent pictures and is very light weight! I have had Cannon Cameras before and they have serviced me well, but his one has been the best so far!

Reviews.Title: Takes great photos
Reviews.Author: Dororhy D
Reviews.Content: The camera takes clear pictures and fits nicely in my purse.  I will be traveling in the future and I plan to take this camera

Reviews.Title: NICE
Reviews.Author: Lady Dee
Reviews.Content: It takes clear pictures and it is simple friendly in operating it.  I would recommend it to someone. Love it

Reviews.Title: It is what it is
Reviews.Author: Alec
Reviews.Content: Does what it says beautiful pictures, wifi, and easy to use. Clicking sound if you zoom while you are videoing is an annoyance that has been prevalent in these small cameras so i can't recommend it to capture video for vlogging, but everything is Canon tried and true.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 130 IS 16.0 MP Digital Camera with 8x Optical Zoom
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Silk
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  It is very easy to use and takes great pictures!  I use it a lot to photograph jewelry and the quality is superb!  I have only had it a short while so have not used all of the camera's features.  Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: I'm probably not qualified to rate this.
Reviews.Author: G. McKay
Reviews.Content: I confess, I just use the basic features, and let the camera decide the rest... and that's worked for me.  The pictures seem pretty decent to me, which is what matters the most.  I poked through the menu, it all seemed user friendly enough.There's no real protection for the screen, so I ended up ordering the case as well.  They're cheap enough, so no point in getting it all scratched up.

Reviews.Title: canon elph
Reviews.Author: Karen Runk
Reviews.Content: I'm still working with it...getting slow in my old age.  It does take nice pics, though...very big so I can see them.  Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Unfortunately got defective (center pixel dead)
Reviews.Author: K. Mehta "km"
Reviews.Content: Amazon had fantastic offer on the prices so I had purchased 4 camera to give as gift (2 gray and 2 red). However 3 out of 4 turned out with center dead pixel. Image also carries the pixel so it is not only on LCD. On one camera it was very easy to see and bit harder on 2 other cameras.So if you plan to give this as gift then first make sure you mark them as gift else user will not be able to return directly and test them out or be ready to return if it turns out to be defective piece.Camera however is good and I have been using Canon for long time now. I am not sure if this issue my cameras or specific manufacturing batch. Since there are other reviews about feature, I wanted to highlight my experience about defective model.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely. In. Love.
Reviews.Author: N. Pollifrone
Reviews.Content: I've recently started a YouTube channel and purchased this camera because of the brand as well as the package deal. I'm absolutely in love with it. I've filmed a corporate video for work that looks so professional. The comments have been nothing short of positive and everyone is so impressed that I captured it all with the Canon PowerShot.If you want to see what this camera is capable of in action, check out my video: http://youtu.be/EgNwrnbN0CkA great purchase. So happy I got it!

Reviews.Title: Great little pocket camera
Reviews.Author: animal lover
Reviews.Content: Stays on automatic until you change it. Does a lot of functions for a little camera. It takes good pictures. Would be good to have an extra battery to have charged to replace drained battery especially when on a trip and taking a lot of pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Courtney
Reviews.Content: I took this camera with me on a cruise to the Caribbean and the pictures are great! No matter what kind of lighting I seemed to have this camera took outstanding pictures. Very pleased with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great value, easy to use, it's totally worth it
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: Worth every penny! Easy to use, has a wi-fi feature to upload pictures to your phone or computer. Good quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: Not Bad
Reviews.Author: Day
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera for the price it takes great pictures.  I love the small compact size.  Pictures are very sharp and clear.  However the video recording is not that good .. if you do not have bright enough light, it comes out dark (normal lighting in my room was not enough).  Also the audio is really really low you can barley hear it.

Reviews.Title: Wi-Fi set up requires a LOT of time and good computer literacy
Reviews.Author: NanaMBC
Reviews.Content: I am an hour into trying to get the wi-fi set up and am calling it quits.  Multiple screens, back and forth, camera not doing what it is supposed to do as the "getting started" guide suggests for necessary steps.  I don't need the wi-fi, just thought it would be fun addition, esp as it is part of the camera.  Forget it.  This is also our third Canon camera in less than ten years. I like the ease of use of the camera and the price, but they don't last long. I bought it again for the familiarity of the camera.

Reviews.Title: JUst what I needed
Reviews.Author: nancy tedrowe
Reviews.Content: I would rather use this simple camera when I want to take pictures instead of a smart phone.  It is just what I wanted for my simple needs.  Can download the pictures, include them in emails or articles I write for local events or print on my color printer - they look great.  Installed the software that came with it on my laptop and can edit the pictures for brightness sharpness etc.  Pictures have been published and shared with friends who all say they look great and I am by far NOT a Photographer. Great price and so easy to use.  Built in flash takes over when needed .

Reviews.Title: Very good Value
Reviews.Author: Carol Phillips
Reviews.Content: Good value for money, takes awesome pics.  The zoom is amazing.  Very compact.  I would recommend to anyone who wants it for travel.

Reviews.Title: Happy with size and picture qualty
Reviews.Author: Robert Smith
Reviews.Content: Had to replace my old camera because it died. I liked the reviews on this camera and the screen size. The instructions on the wifi could be written better. Had to get my grandson to explain it to me. Ready to travel and take pictures.

Reviews.Title: Cannon 130
Reviews.Author: Outback
Reviews.Content: I have had Cannon Powershot cameras for years. Only worn out one, the rest I have lost. They are small enough I carry it in my pocket at all times, They are handy and quick and take excellent pictures. I almost always get a nice comment about the pictures I share. I have run over them and still worked. This is a durable camera.

Reviews.Title: Stuck in the 90's
Reviews.Author: P. Dean "pdsinger"
Reviews.Content: My first impression was that the camera was difficult to hold and handle.  Not that big a deal.  However, the WiFi setup turned out to be the killer.  Canon's instructions and software needs to be updated from the 90's.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: JReader
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera for Christmas. So far, I really enjoy it! I used it to take some pictures the other day when some friends and I went out. The picture quality was amazing. I also was happy that it was so small it fit nicely in my pocket. It came with everything I needed. I did have to get a memory card, but I got one at Walmart for like 12.00. I haven't tried taking any videos with it yet, but I am sure they will be great. I do enjoy the wireless feature of this camera too! Great asset!

Reviews.Title: Canon Elph 130 IS
Reviews.Author: tmeyer
Reviews.Content: So far, this camera is everything it is purported to be.  Very light, small and fast to power-up.  First time to upload via Wi-Fi to my PC was a no-brainer, if you know the password of your network.

Reviews.Title: Does its job
Reviews.Author: Lily
Reviews.Content: For the price this camera met my expectations. I purchased this camera for my 62 year old mother that is not technically proficient and she works it just fine. Only reason I don't give this camera 5 stars I would have liked better picture quality. The images can be a bit grainy if you don't have the perfect environment. For comparison sake I take better pictures with my iPhone 5. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: An excellent LITTLE camera.
Reviews.Author: Norman M. Kaminsky
Reviews.Content: It is a very well made camera, deliver very sharp photos. It is very small, and easy to carry. However, that very feature makes a bit harder to control. You have concentrate on what you are doing, in order not to cover the flash, or accidentally hit other controls. With practice it will be a great tool!

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Gila
Reviews.Content: a little tricky at first, not too difficult to figure out though, very clear, excellent for what you payed for, i am very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Knight
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this camera. I really wanted it for the wifi capabilities and that is really a great aspect of the camera. You do need to watch the battery life, as it will suck down as you use the wifi. Other than that it is awesome! Got one for me and one for a Christmas present.

Reviews.Title: Very good.
Reviews.Author: Fern
Reviews.Content: I gave this to my sister as a gift and she loves it.She has no problem bringing it with her when she travelled.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: KP
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in preparation for a 2 week trip to Australia and New Zealand. We played around with all the compact cameras at Best Buy, and this one has great zoom, fun features, and fast-taking pictures for the price. It's pretty small and light, super easy to use with both a auto setting and a programs setting. The fun features are under this program setting and create fun effects such as Super Vivid which makes photos appear very bright (like technicolor) which is really helpful on overcast/rainy days in making dull colors more vibrant. It has color selection which you can program to select a certain color and the rest of the picture will be black and white! So much fun! I does take pictures pretty darn fast from turning on to being able to take a picture. I even dropped it in a streaming, few inches deep puddle whilst the lens was zoomed out and it still worked perfectly!!! It's a really fun camera with all of the cool effects and it takes quality pictures as well. Love it!

Reviews.Title: Small camera
Reviews.Author: Kathleen B
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect.  Takes great pictures, even in a dark area. I bought it for taking pictures at work.  It takes great pictures, even in a semi dark area where I want a clear picture of pipes and valves.  This little camera fits in my pocket.  The wide angle option comes in very handy. I take pictures to write procedures at work.  I load the picture to my computer, open it in paint and put arrows and text boxes on it to explain how things work. Perfect for what I need.  All the pictures are clear and I take these pictures inside a factory without good lighting.

Reviews.Title: Adequate camera for basic photos, but not great
Reviews.Author: M. E. Kunes
Reviews.Content: The camera functions well in prime lighting conditions, but in standard room lighting the pictures seem to be somewhat blurry even though this is a 16MP camera. It is adequate an an inexpensive camera that covers the basics and fits conveniently in a pocket, but don't expect to get great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Stellar
Reviews.Author: Terence O'Halloran
Reviews.Content: It's everything I bought it for.  Pictures are point and shoot perfect, crisp, and with enough light, clear. Smallenough for a shirt pocket and good enough to impress anyone who looks at thee pics.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: brenda f. blankenship
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this camera to everyone ,takes very good quality pictures. We travel a lot and love pics of our adventures!!!!

Reviews.Title: I really like it
Reviews.Author: Pamela
Reviews.Content: It takes wonderful photos and videos. Not very sharp with closeup images though, but not anything I can't deal with.

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed for my fishing trips.
Reviews.Author: peter w. colvill
Reviews.Content: Small enough, clips on my waders, point & shoot, picture quality is excellent & easy to use what else can I say.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot ELPH 16.0 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: winston37
Reviews.Content: I haven't used it a lot since I received it, but the times I have I find it very simple to operate, has very clear pictures(I got some developed the other day) is very light weight and just all in all a good camera for the price. I thought my last one was a goodcamera and it was but I feel this one supersedes it. I would definitely recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Temima
Reviews.Content: really great camera. got it as a present for someone and one for myself! its super easy to use but takes clear pictures :)

Reviews.Title: Video mB too large to upload onto websites
Reviews.Author: Insight
Reviews.Content: There is actually no option to decrease the megabytes of a video so that it can be uploaded to blogs and other sites that have MINIMIM mb requirements.  There are only 2 choices of higher quality (therefore more mb) video.  I hate the software it comes with also. It's a shame about these technicalities, because i do like cannon better than the similar Nokia and Sony ones i had of same caliber.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Ferguson
Reviews.Content: Great little camera.  Tucks in a pocket or purse.  Action pictures are a bit hard to capture.  Met my need for a point and shoot

Reviews.Title: first time use
Reviews.Author: charlie L.
Reviews.Content: bought this camera to replace one that passes away on vacation in july. old one had a view finder, which us old folks liked. just returned from british isles. camera seems to take a while to focus in to a clear view of what you are looking at. and of course when it is sunny I have no idea what I am taking a photo of.

Reviews.Title: Small but great
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: Needed a camera for a European River Cruise this summer. We do not have much room and will be traveling long distance to begin our cruise.  This "mighty mite" fits all our needs and will provide all the wonderful memories that we are so much looking forward to.  Nice camera, simple to use!

Reviews.Title: Bad instruction book, bad button and access capability, bad experience
Reviews.Author: Frederick Hornick
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera hoping it would be an easy way to post online images to my android phone and Facebook.  It wasn't! Spent hours trying to make the connections and never was able to do so to my phone, receiving an unresolvable "bugging" message that stopped me cold.  The operating buttons were small and crammed together making them hard to access.  Too many variations in accessing different functions.  I finally returned it for a refund and will not consider getting another Canon product..

Reviews.Title: STOPPED WORKING THE 2ND DAY!!
Reviews.Author: John Taylor
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to take pictures during car rebuild and on day 2 the camera would not operate.The camera is going back and look for a more reliable one.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera performance!
Reviews.Author: Rodney D. Edge
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because I do property preservation work, which if you know anything about that work, know you take a lot of photos, like 75-150 photos every job, and you need to be able to go fairly quickly. This camera is my third of the compact digital variety, and my second Canon. the first two worked very well, except that you got blurry photos quite often, as sometimes, like when approaching a stop sign, you don't come to a complete stop. This camera advertised it fixes this...BULL! Also, when you want to take a photo, it seems like an eternity to actually take it. It may only be 2-3 seconds in real life, but when you are taking a lot of photos, it is very slow. Multiply that time to wait to take a photo or to take more than 1 photo by 5 to 8 times when in flash mode, and if you try and push the shutter too quickly (like within 2 seconds after flash) you will normally have to back up and try again. My other cameras did not have such problems. It is very frustrating. In fact, as I am writing this, I had to reduce my star rating from 2 to 1 as this is making me re-live my frustration again. Please buy a different camera. You will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: GREAT LITLE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: JUNEBUGG
Reviews.Content: This camera is a perfect size and very easy to use.  I have not delved into all of the wonderful applications yet, but as of now I love it.  The Amazon price was lower than anywhere else and that is always a plus.

Reviews.Title: Best P&S; Camera on the Market
Reviews.Author: Zelle
Reviews.Content: Did a lot of research, this one was the best simple camera I could buy without buying a DSLR camera. I was going on a trip to Thailand and I didn't want to have to lug around a massive camera that I would worry about getting stolen. This camera did the job. Definitely not DSLR quality, but I'm not about capturing the PERFECT moment so much as capturing the moment.

Reviews.Title: Small size, big value.
Reviews.Author: William Guion "Heartwood author, founder of 1...
Reviews.Content: Small size, big value. And takes great pics easily -- don't have to be a pro to get quality images. I love how I can just drop this in my pocket and carry it anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera, super smart auto mode and its super portable
Reviews.Author: Matthew De Jongh "matthewd5 in Maine"
Reviews.Content: Great camera, my wife tried mine and liked it so much we got her one too!Definitely get the extra warranty! I dropped mine on hard marble floor at the Vatican! Almost said a for letter word, the screen got damaged

Reviews.Title: Good enough for what I needed
Reviews.Author: M Shaffer
Reviews.Content: Was disappointed that movies can only be shot 10 minutes at a time. Takes great close-up pics, and turns on almost immediately. Not a bad little camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: ZOOM HITS TARGET
Reviews.Author: Barbara Mims Deming
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Canon to replace an older one. I wanted more zoom and this one fits that request perfectly. It allows me to leave my heavier longer-range-zoom camera behind on many trips I make to take photographs. I am a creative writer/instructor and have recommended this camera to students for the ease to carry, the nice zoom range, and the Canon name.

Reviews.Title: Remarkable Camera
Reviews.Author: Paul Uhland
Reviews.Content: This amazing little $89,  8-ounce cam takes great pics, has an unbelievable array of features: 8x zooms, takes videos, even. As a casual user, so far  I love it. Still exploring  the many built-in  'bells and whistles'.

Reviews.Title: PowerShot 130 IS Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Deborah Berg
Reviews.Content: This is just what I needed. Small, easy to handle, great price, and it does what I want it to! Great for the avid and beginner Photographer alike. I still use my SONY, but this one has more for me to utilize on certain shots. Thanks Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for point and shoot!
Reviews.Author: Omar Sekandary
Reviews.Content: Perfect consumer camera for the average user. Easy to use and transfer photos. Great quality picture and even does short videos.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use and wonderful photos for beginners and intermediate photographers
Reviews.Author: sheri dammarell
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. The photos are crisp and I haven't read the entire book but will learn more as time goes by. I am very satisfied with this product. Thank you Amazon for keeping the price down!!!! I know that I would be shopping less often if it weren't for your very reasonable pricing and great and secure shipping!

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Ralph Fredella
